message_1: A factory produces 5 different types of toys. They want to create a gift box containing 3 toys of any type. In how many different ways can they choose the toys for the gift box?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items (in this case, 5 types of toys), k is the number of items to choose (in this case, 3 toys), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

So, we have:

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!(5-3)!)

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!2!)

C(5, 3) = (5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(2 × 1))

C(5, 3) = (120) / (6 × 2)

C(5, 3) = 120 / 12

C(5, 3) = 10

So, there are 10 different ways to choose the toys for the gift box.
